div.pre: 2123 S. Maria di Licodia, N of Paterno, (917 = 217) 1890 Burial: c. 370 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 80+ AR. Pot hoard Messana: 3 tetradr. Motya: 1 tetradr. Selinus: 1 tetradr. Syracuse: 67 decadr. (Cimon 8, Euainetos 20, unsigned 39) 6 tetradr. Athens: 2 tetradr. Pegasi: a number (Evans later stated "many Pegasi," NC 1894, p. 218) Disposition: (decadr.): Syracuse 2; A. S. Dewing, ex Philadelphia, Penn. Acad. of Fine Arts, 10-12 (= nos. 1 [Cimon]?, 6-16 of the Spink publication, whose no. 11 is doubtfully from this hd.); Boston 1 (Brett 421); Jameson 1 (Cat. 835 = NC 1891, pl. 12); New York (Met. Mus.) 3 (= Ward Cat. 293-5); Berlin, von Gwinner, 1; Baltimore, Evergreen House, ex J. W. Garrett, 1. Most of preceding are catalogued in Gallatin † Evans, NC 1891, pp. 217-54, illus. Some Additional Medallions (14) from the Santa Maria Hoard (Spink & Son, n.d.), 2 pl., no text Jenkins, ANSCent., p. 377 Currò Pisanò, AIIN 1962-4, p. 221 AN 1890, p. 184 and Procès-verbaux, p. 9 report as many as 150 decadr.
